snippet: The church of a pastor facing drug charges may sound like a plot device in a stoner movie, but Hawai’i Cannabis THC Ministry raises serious issues.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column on Religious Science practitioner Roger Christie, who was indicted in 2010 on charges including conspiracy to manufacture and distribute marijuana; notes Christie's lawyers say he should be allowed to present a religious-freedom defense at  eventual criminal trial, as Christie is founder of Hawaii church that espouses use of drug.
lead_paragraph: The church of a pastor facing drug charges may sound like a plot device in a stoner movie, but Hawai’i Cannabis THC Ministry raises serious issues.

headline.print_headline: As a Religion, Marijuana-Infused Faith Pushes Commonly Held Limits
headline.main: As a Religion, Marijuana-Infused Faith Pushes Commonly Held Limits
